parameters.description: Determines whether a mandatory Email field is added to the login screen. Use this parameter to demonstrate that in BPT, a single component can be modified without updating other tests. Default = No. Yes = Add the Email Address field.
UserName:Password for AppPulse user to trigger the relevant AppPulse features.
Defines the number of times to repeat a call to ShipEx. Use this parameter to find unnecessary multiple calls to the same methods, and affects performance. Default = 0 (no repeat calling.

Defines whether to move a Headphones item (product-id=13) from the Headphones category to the Speakers category. Use this parameter to demonstrate an error in GUI or API testing. Default = No (category is not changed). Yes = Modify the product category.
Defines the number of seconds to delay the retrieval of countries during user registration. Default = 0 (no delay). Possible values = Any positive integer.

Determines whether to modify the field names on the user registration page. (Preferred payment method > Favorite payment; Phone > Mobile phone) Use this parameter to demonstrate API testing. Default = No. Yes = Use the second WSDL request to register a new user
Defines a sum to be added to each cart calculation. The sum is updated in to both the Web and Mobile UI (no API). A user must be logged in to enable this change. Default = 0 (no sum added)

Defines the amount of memory leak in megabytes while retrieving the order history. The memory leak is visible in both the UI and the API. Default = 0 (no leak at all). Positive Integer = Number, multiplied by 1000. For example 1 = 1000 megabyte memory leak.
To generate a exhaustion of PostgresSQL locks, go to CONTACT US type ‘database’ at the Subject and click SEND.
Defines the maximum number of concurrent users allowed. Any additional users are rejected with an error code 500. Default = 0 (no concurrent sessions allowed). Possible values = Any positive integer.
Determines whether spelling errors appear in the UI. Default = No. Yes = The following spelling errors are shown: - SHIPING DETAILS - Ciity - Recipeint Details (Web only) - ORDERR SUMMARY (Web only)
parameters.locationInAdvantage: Web: ORDER PAYMENT page ; Mobile: SHIPPING DETAILS page

parameters.description: Determines whether pictures are placed differently on the home page when viewed on an Android  device. Use this parameter to demonstrate how the application may function differently on different mobile OSs. Default = No. Yes = Pictures are placed differently on Android devices.
Defines the number of seconds to add as a delay in response time when a logged in user adds an item to cart. Default = 0 (no delay).
Defines the number of seconds to add as a delay in response time when trying to login. Default = 0 (no delay). If you modify this value, also modify the SLA_add_delay_sessions parameter.

Defines a number of concurrent users sessions at which a delay is added to login response. Enabled only when SLA_add_delay_time is set to a number greater than 0. Default = 20. Valid values = 0-n. The system starts adding a delay if the number of sessions is greater than the defined value. It will stop the delay if the number of sessions is decreased to less than the defined value. If you modify this value, also modify the SLA_add_delay_time parameter.
Determines whether NV report shows problems and errors: HTTP Codes 4xx and 5xx, loading unused libraries, timeout, downloading big images, etc.
Creates a difference in the prices shown in the UI and the prices used in the API. Default = No. Yes = Price is doubled in the UI only, for both desktop and mobile, across the entire app.

Determines whether an invalid passwords are allowed. These would trigger an error in a test, indicating a security gap in the product. Default = No. Yes = Invalid passwords allowed, such as an empty password, or ‘1’=’1’

To demonstrate the DevOpps process in a lifecycle management product, do the following:         1. In Octane, in your product release, add a user story to change an invalid user name or password text.         2. Demonstrate that you can view this new user story in your IDE.         3. Implement the user story by changing the MESSAGE_USER_LOGIN_FAILED error message in the following file: \adm-demo-app\accountservice\src\main\java\com\advantage\accountsoap\model\Account.java.         For example, change it from "Invalid user name or password" to "Incorrect user name or password, please try again".         4. Demonstrate the DevOps process and that you can now see the new error message on both desktop and mobile.
The quantity of products in a single purchase that are entitled to free shipping. Default = 1.

The shipping cost is determined by a table table in the 'shipex-mock-for-db.properties' configuration file, according to country.  Shipping costs to countries not defined in the table are determined based on the value for Other.  Free shipping can be provided when the number of items ordered is equal to or less than the value  of the 'ShipEx_Free_Number_Of_Products' configuration parameter (default = 1).

The Advantage demo site uses the following software versions and interfaces:  - Java server: Java 8  - Application server: Tomcat 8  - Web UI: Angular 1.47  - Admin Application: Standalone .NET  - Database: PostgreSQL 9.4  - Schema Management: Liquibase 3.4  - Catalog, Order Services: REST API  - User Management: WSDL.
The demo app IP addresses are not fixed. In any scripts you create for a demo, make sure to use a parameter for the application IP address.

To use your GPS location instead of the default values, toggle on the Use my location option on the following pages:  1. CREATE ACCOUNT, for the user account details.  2. ORDER PAYMENT, for the shipping details.
parameters.locationInAdvantage: Create Account, Order Payment - Shipping details

parameters.description: To demonstrate WebSocket features, use the chat widget located on the Home page (http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com/), under Contact Us.

Use the following UI elements to demonstrate various functional testing features:  * String: On the CREATE ACCOUNT or ACCOUNT DETAILS page, update the Personal Details fields.  * Radio button: On the ORDER PAYMENT page, select a payment method.  * Date value: On the ORDER PAYMENT page, select the MasterCredit option and then enter an expiration date.  * List box: On the CREATE ACCOUNT page, select a country from the Country drop down list.  * Multiple selection: Browse products by category and filter the products shown by using the options on the left

The Admin UI menu and pages are read-only in the shared system on the cloud.  You can make changes in a local instance.  Troubleshooting: If you are unable to make changes in a local instance:  1. Navigate to the DemoApp.properties file.  2. Ensure that the Allow user configuration value is set to Yes. This is the default setting.  3. Verify that you can configure the relevant field from the Admin UI as needed.

Replace the ShipEx, MasterCredit, or SafePay 3rd party services with Service Virtualization by updating the relevant URLs in the services.properties configuration file.  This file is located in properties folder of 5 services: accountservice, MasterCredit, order, ROOT, SafePay.  For example: /accountservice/properties/services.properties.  1. Navigate to the <service-name>.url.host line, and modify the URL/IP address string to the Service Virtualization URL and IP address.  2. Navigate to the <service-name>.url.port line and modify the port string to the Service Virtualization port.  3. Save the file, and repeat these steps for each service in the services.properties file, and in the services.properties files for each service.

To demonstrate this feature, browse to one of the following products and view the demo video:  - HP ROAR WIRELESS SPEAKER (Product ID: 22)  - BEATS STUDIO 2 OVER-EAR MATTE BLACK HEADPHONES (product ID: 15)  - HP ELITEPAD 1000 G2 TABLET (product ID: 16)
The button text always starts with Pay to allow for demonstrating regular expressions in object identification.

To use Swagger interface for REST APIs change the URL to http://<your-server>:<port>/<service>/api/docs.  <service> can be on of the following (case sensitive): catalog, order, MasterCredit or SafePay.  For example: http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com:80/catalog/api/docs.
Send the REST API request and parameters in request URL. Example: http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com/catalog/api/v1/products/1.

Send the REST API parameters in the request body. Example: http://www.advantageonlineshopping.com/MasterCredit/api/v1/payments/payment, body: { "MCCVVNumber": 666, "MCCardNumber": 6543210987654321, "MCCustomerName": "King David", "MCCustomerPhone": "+12025551969", "MCExpirationDate": "032017", "MCRecevingAmount.Value": 2011.03, "MCRecevingCard.AccountNumber": 112987298763, "MCRecevingCard.Currency": "USD", "MCTransactionDate": "02092016", "MCTransactionType": "PAYMENT" }.
Send login request and response in Base-64 encoded, instead of in plain text, to show DFE in snapshot (display only).

To demonstrate validation: Perform a flow where you buy the contents of the cart, then go to the My Orders page and look for the order by its order number (shows positive validation). Delete the order, then look for the order by its number again (shows negative validation).

Add an option to enable the user to take a picture with the camera . This picture will be added to the current product page. In offline mode, the picture is retained for the current session only. When using MC, if “Camera Sensor” is enabled, this picture will be replaced with the picture the user previously uploaded to MC.

A functional test finds the following defect: The user creates a user with any Username, but the name that is actually created is duplicated, as displayed at the top right side of the site.   The user opens a defect, fixes the code, and commits the change. This triggers a Fortify scan (provided that you added the Fortify scan trigger in the code change) that will find an SQL injection vulnerability.  To achieve this, you must edit the accountservice\src\main\java\com\advantage\accountsoap\dao\impl\DefaultAccountRepository file. In this file, first uncomment the code that is located between the 'SQL injection vulnerability' tags.  Then, comment out the code that is located between the 'Code without SQL injection vulnerability' tags. Note that there are 2 locations in the code in which you need to make these changes.
